attributes.action: Create a NHS and Care Commission to review and manage all health care in the UK.
attributes.background: The 21st C has brought new challenges to the health and care provision which underpins the well being of all in the UK. It is timely to review the NHS to ensure that it meets modern needs but retains the ethos of equality of services and  provision, free at point of delivery.

attributes.action: Make polygamy a specific criminal offence
attributes.background: Bigamy is a criminal offence in the UK and it therefor makes no sense for polygamy not to be a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details: House of Commons Briefing Paper number 05051 dated 6th January 2016.

attributes.action: Make it law that all public toilets should have baby changing facilities.
attributes.background: Because fathers either have to give their child to a women to take into the ladies toilet to change their nappy, or change their child on the floor of the mens bathroom. It is a violation of the discrimination act that baby changing facilities are not found in mens restrooms.

attributes.action: Legalise muskets, cannons and swords for self defence
attributes.background: Similar to the second amendment in the US, muskets, swords and cannons can be possessed if a relevant licence is held (level 1 for a sword, level 2 for a musket and 3 for a cannon)the weapons cannot be concealed.Also create a body to monitor gun owners and distribute licences.

attributes.action: All new trees planted on Government owned land should be fruit trees
attributes.background: All new trees on Government owned land should be fruit trees and the produce of those trees should be made freely available to members of the public

attributes.action: Pay parity to all recipients of a British retirement Pension.
attributes.background: Unfair treatment to some recipients, in largely Commonwealth countries, where pensions are frozen in some countries, but not others. A classic example is Canada frozen, America not frozen.

attributes.action: Stop the reassessment and resultant refusal of blue badges to disabled people
attributes.background:
A GOVERNMENT SHOULD BE JUDGED UPON HOW IT TREATS ITS LEAST FORTUNATE CITIZENS 
We are in a period of time where disabled people all across the country are being re-assessed for their needs, including their access to a blue badge. Please put a stop to the 1000s of disabled people losing them unjust.
attributes.additional_details: Not only is this reassessment traumatic enough for disabled people, with the potential consequence of losing their ability to confidently leave the house, assessors are in a position where they have to justify their performance through means of denying access to a certain number of people, thus looking to deny future access to a blue badge wherever they see fit. Recently, a family member who cannot walk 50 feet was told her blue badge is being revoked, due to 'evidence' that they can walk fine.

attributes.action: Only British Born Citizens can have: Health Care - Benefits / Housing / Voting
attributes.background: Only British Born Citizens have rights to: Government owned or sponsored Health Care & Housing / Benefits / Voting. Citizens living in the country 20 or more years can have the same rights if they already have British citizenship.
attributes.additional_details: Just trying to save UK from outside influences usually only British born citizens and long standing citizens really care about the country and there fellow neighbors.

attributes.action: Let children go on holiday when they like & keep schools open 253 days a year.
attributes.background: Many families are priced out of holidays because traditional school holidays cause peaks in demand. If schools are open all year round families can synchronise their holiday to suit their work commitments. Schools can then arrange catch up lessons for children who have been on holiday.
attributes.additional_details:
Long summer holidays disrupt children`s education and inhibit learning.

The economy of the country would benefit as families would not have to rely on expensive holiday child care.

Industry would benefit from parents not having to take time off work due to child care commitments.

Children will receive more education creating a better educated society.

Parents will avoid being fined for taking children out of school.

More full time jobs would be created rather than seasonal employment.

attributes.action: Allow voters to choose to rerun an election if a plurality wish it.
attributes.background: It's clear from the turnout at elections that voters are disenchanted with politics.  Many claim they dislike all candidates. All ballot papers should have an option for None of the above (NOTA). If NOTA gets more votes than any candidate, that area's election should be rerun with new candidates.
attributes.additional_details: Voter turnout in the UK has been on a long-term downward trend.  Before 2000, national elections typically attracted over 70% turnout (see http://www.ukpolitical.info/Turnout45.htm) and 80% in the early 1950s.  Since 2000, general election turnout has been below 70%.  In addition, the ability to reject a slate of candidates would address or ease many of the issues identified in the Parliamentary report here: http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201415/cmselect/cmpolcon/232/23205.htm

attributes.action: Stop schools charging a fee to allow children to eat packed lunches.
attributes.background: Some state schools are charging parents up to £1.80 per child daily to eat a packed lunch on school premises. This is as much as the cost of a school meal.  Parents are paying twice to feed their children. The cost is disproportionate to the effort expended by the school to supervise lunchtimes.
attributes.additional_details:
This was uncovered by the teaching union NASUWT and reported in the press on 28th March 2016. 

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/education/educationnews/12206157/State-schools-charge-parents-to-let-children-eat-their-own-packed-lunches.html

attributes.action: Stop landlords from discriminating against young people
attributes.background: Landlords legally have the right to disallow young people usually 18-24 from renting their properties. Most use the stereotypical excuse of "they just want to party" or "they wreck the place" I myself have become homeless due to this and discrimination against any characteristic should be banned.

attributes.action: Make the size of motorcyle you are able to get at the age of 19-20 be a 600 cc
attributes.background: it is the threshold of not being too powerful for riders that have been riding for 2 years and allows them to get used to a slightly more powerful bike before they upgrade to an unlimited liscence this will allow bikers to gain vital experience if they feel they are ready to get a larger cc later on
attributes.additional_details:
You are more likly to have a crash on a motorcyle however it should be the riders choice to ride a larger or smaller bike.
This link shows that the rate of deaths caused by motorcycles was falling by 9% in 2012 before the new age restricted Euro laws were applied. And a large number of bike crashes were caused by car drivers not paying attention to them
http://www.motorcyclenews.com/news/2015/march/new-accident-stats-show-large-decrease
These are the most up to date statistics

attributes.action: Bring back the death sentence for proven murder and rape cases
attributes.background: A lot of people are convicted of murder and rape in the UK, and we are suppose to bring justice to those people, but instead they are imprisoned (and usually even get out eventually!) and tax payers and the government pay for their food, drinks, shelter. We shouldn't waste money on keeping them here
attributes.additional_details: The government needs to think how much money they spend on keeping evil monsters alive, the number will be high! The supporters of this petition believe that people who are convicted of rape and murder to be able to receive death sentences from the court. If justice is served, the number of cases of such crimes may even go down. However, of course 100% evidence must be given before handing out such a sentence.

attributes.action: force absent parents to see their children
attributes.background: absent parents put their needs first before their children,force the absent parent to see their children after all children are a lifetime commitment for both parents.children need a relationship with mum and dad through out their childhood.

attributes.action: Require Royal Mint to 'buy back' Legal Tender coinage it has issued
attributes.background: Apparently the Royal Mint has recently instructed banks not to buy back commemorative coinage such as the 2015 Buckingham Palace £100 silver coin that it issued as Legal Tender thus forcing holders of said coins to the open market
attributes.additional_details: Legal Tender - the majority of people take the phrase 'Legal Tender'  to mean that when this is applied to coinage it will be acceptable at a Bank

attributes.action: Reopen the maternity ward in Crawley Hospital
attributes.background: East surrey hospital and worthing hospital is a long way to go for ladies in labour in the Crawley/Horsham area.

attributes.action: Form an elite squadron of special forces within the G8 to execute all IS members
attributes.background: With the recent atrocities in France and Belgium the world needs to eradicate IS. Action needs to be done to stop these murderers. I propose the G8 countries establish an elite special forces to execute all known IS members on the recent list of 2000+ members from the intelligence found last month.
attributes.additional_details: Members of IS need to be wiped out. They should lose their human rights when they sign up. Too many innocent people from all over the world are losing their lives and bringing fear to millions because of idiotic beliefs which have no right in this world. The only way to deal with these brain washed murderers is to eradicate them.

attributes.action: Scrap the DVLA restriction to assign any age number plate to any age car
attributes.background:
This means that people can apply a personalised registration plate on any age car regardless of the age of plate 
Making it easier for DVLA to sell number plates and making them more valuable as they are more applicable.
attributes.additional_details:
Scrap the dated restriction preventing the application of newer style number plates to old cars 
Information on a cars actual year of release is widely available in the modern times apps HPI checks etc and this would become buyer responsibility similar to checking if a car is stolen or written off when buying. 
Making it harder to get caught out e.g 2006 plate on a 2004 car would HPI check as 2004 car.
This would mean less paperwork for DVLA and more revenue from personalised registrations

attributes.action: Remove the Value Added Tax charged on toilet rolls and make them VAT Exempt.
attributes.background: Value Added Tax is currently charged by HM Treasury on the sale of toilet rolls at the rate of 20%. I believe that this should be abolished as they are not "non-essential, luxury items" and are an essential item as are female hygeine products which are rated at 5%.

attributes.action: Raise the minium wage to £10ph a realistic living standard to not get into debt
attributes.background: The basic minimum wage is a unreasonable income to live off of especially having the responsibility of a child/ children. It is a big struggle for many working class parents/ people to make do in the society we live in to actually live off of the basic wage provided. Many people have got into debt.
attributes.additional_details: My own personal experience of getting into debt due to having to change jobs because of unsuitability, not earning enough income and then having to rely back on benefits to support myself and family showed me that wages need to be reasonable to actually live on. I have been unable to save for many years which I want to do and have been struggling to provide for my family/ myself due to the lack of suitable available work. I believe people with a stable income and career benefit our economy.

attributes.action: Delay the referendum on EU in/out until such time as the public can be educated
attributes.background: Leaving,  or remaining within, the EU is a huge decision with far reaching implications. As yet, a satisfactory, objective method of educating the decisions makers (the public) on the facts has yet to be discovered.  More time is needed to lay out the case, so the public can decide, based on facts.
attributes.additional_details:
Popular media channels are awash with the public pleading with so called subject matter experts to present objective facts to add credibility to the either the 'in' or 'out' campaigns. 

We propose that the referendum be delayed until such time that both cases can be presented fairly and properly to the public.

attributes.action: End the supply of alcoholic drinks to MP's / Peers in the Palace of Westminster.
attributes.background:
MP's and Peers are able to purchase alcoholic drinks at a subsidized price at bars in the palace of Westminster costing the tax payer over £4million per year.
As a place of work Westminster should be kept dry with provision of food and soft drinks only. our MPs should vote with a clear head.

attributes.action: Require local traffic planners to install uncontrolled roundabouts at junctions.
attributes.background: Traffic lights have been installed at number of recent new road schemes which continually disrupt the smooth flow of traffic in spite of the overwhelming evidence of the numerous existing junctions with uncontrolled roundabouts which keep traffic flowing smoothly.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the junctions which should have been controlled by roundabouts without lights but which suffer continual disruption from irrational traffic lights in spite of the evidence of numerous roundabouts nearby in Wokingham are at:
Cutbush Lane and Brookers Hill on the A327
Winners Farm, Station Link Road and William Heelas Way on the A329

attributes.action: If Trump is elected President the UK should cut all diplomatic ties with the US.
attributes.background: If trump implements any of the policies he has announced, denying non US Citizen Muslims entry to the country, allowing torture, the killing of terrorist's families etc etc.  The UK Government should recall its ambassador, cut all ties and designate the US a 'Rogue State"

attributes.action: To implement a minimum wage for people under the age of 16.
attributes.background: This is part of a GCSE Citizenship campaign that is to bring about change in society. We are a group of 14 and 15 year olds that feel the need to make a change. This campaign is worth supporting because it is to bring about equality and make a change in society.

attributes.action: Stop car insurance companies from discrimination against sex, age and occupation
attributes.background: Car insurance companies seem exempt from discrimination laws (Equality Act 2010) and discriminate against sex, age and occupation. They are also guilty of assuming an individual is a "bad driver" in contradiction to the statement "innocent until proven guilty," (The Human Rights Act 1998)

attributes.action: Close loopholes for multinationals before adding Licence Fees for BBC iPlayer
attributes.background: The culture secretary has today announced that he would bring forward legislation "as soon as possible" so that those watching catch-up TV do not get "a free ride".
attributes.additional_details:
This shows the skewed priorities of this government as the amount of money lost to Multi-national companies using unethical tax practices far exceeds the money to be made from the few people watching iPlayer without  a TV licence, and unfairly penalises those who have no wish to watch TV but need a computer for other purposes. 

http://www.theguardian.com/technology/2015/jun/24/amazons-uk-business-paid-119m-tax-last-year

http://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/dec/15/starbucks-pays-uk-corporation-tax-8-million-pounds

http://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/mar/03/barclays-luxembourg-profits-tax-report

http://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/jul/09/budget-means-hsbc-and-standard-chartered-banks-will-pay-1bn-less-in-tax

attributes.action: Stop any added increase to the pensionable age of retirement
attributes.background: All people are entitled to some degree of dignity in old age. To raise the retirement age would be detrimental  to people's health and quality of life. People work their entire lives, the last years should be spent enjoying what they have worked so hard to achieve. This is immoral and unworkable.

attributes.action: Pour more money into science and biotech
attributes.background: Stem cell research at Cambridge and Imperial, Medicine at Oxford and London etc are all world-leading. Therefore, the UK has some of the best in the world.  We have pioneered so many new techniques and technologies here, we should be incredibly proud of it. We should fund it however difficult.
attributes.additional_details:
We just unveiled a new DNA project too to sequence 100,000 genomes. That sort of stuff is awesome and will make a huge difference in 5-10 years. We also have a stem cell bank at Cambridge, and we should expand that and make it the best in the world. That would be tremendously powerful for analysing health outcomes, risks and helping people prevent diseases. To that end we need only 30% percent reduction in military spending. Imagine what we can do then.
We can pay for science more that way.

attributes.action: Compulsory microchip scanning for dogs
attributes.background: In 2014, statistics show 70,000 missing pets in the UK. Many of these were dogs, and a large percentage are still missing. In April 2016 it will be compulsory to chip dogs. This will only work if checks are made.  We are looking for all vets and wardens to scan dogs, plus random checks on homes.
attributes.additional_details: A large percentage  of missing dogs are micro-chipped, but this is useless unless someone scans the dogs. Many of the dogs have been taken in or sold to unsuspecting people, some are in puppy farms, others used for dog fighting. There are so many lost pet sites now online, but we need ONE national database that all wardens have to use, and COMPULSORY scanning by all vets and wardens. Also a system of random checking of homes/farms/travellers sites to scan dogs.

attributes.action: Police should be trained to enforce law correctly without using racial profiling
attributes.background: Racial profiling affects every ethnic minority who is stopped and searched by police. But according to the statistics provided by the Ministry of Justice, some police do seem to be using racial profiling to abuse the law.
attributes.additional_details: Asian people are over five times more likely to be stopped and searched than white people. Black people are seven times more likely to be stopped and searched than white people.

attributes.action: Allow parents with a court order to be helped by local authorities with housing
attributes.background: Local authorities will only deem the person who receives child benefit to be entitled to any help with housing even when there is a court order in place stating children are to live with the other parent for half the week which is unfair and leaves so many parents in financial difficulty

attributes.action: Up the minimum wage from £6.70 to £7.50 for all workers above the age of 21.
attributes.background: Workers above the age of 21 should be entitled to the same wage as workers who are 25 years and older. People within the 21-24 age bracket need to survive just as much as 25+ year old workers who are entitled for more. And for what reason gives them a higher entitlement as we are all equals?
attributes.additional_details: I feel it's not fair and should be taken into account for debate in the house of commons. This is discriminating towards people between the age bracket of 21-24 and I don't believe this is fair on people who are bullied into employment, having to take on any job they can possibly find at minimum wage. I don't see a problem with having to find a job to get by in life, but why does the government discriminate against people like us who struggle as it stands to survive on such a small income?

attributes.action: Allow dogs to visit consenting long staying patients in hospitals.
attributes.background: Research in America has demonstrated the uplifting effects experienced by both patients and staff when dogs are allowed to wander around hospital corridors and wards.
attributes.additional_details:
Dogs probably will not directly help a human to recover from illness, but dogs make humans happy. And feeling happy does make humans more likely to recover from illness.

The petitioner has been unable to find evidence of any diseases which are carried by dogs being transmitted to humans. 

How many diseases can you think of which a dog can transmit to a human during a hospital visit?

How many diseases can you think of which a human can transmit to a human during a hospital visit?

attributes.action: Use reading prison for the homeless and ex service men and women!
attributes.background: I saw a post on how reading prison is empty yet still being heated 24/7 while there are homeless people out there freezing without a roof over there heads! Surely this building can be better used!!

attributes.action: Abolish the ELQ policy and give mature students a second chance.
attributes.background: The Equivalent or Lower Qualification policy prohibits second time students from getting a student loan, limiting those who want to fulfil their potential. It was supposed to save money to fund first time students. There is no evidence of this.
attributes.additional_details: I attended university in 1997 and gained a BA in Illustration. My career as a graphic designer never worked out, I had kids and worked for little money at home.  Now nearly 40 I wish to pursue a career in mental health care, starting with a BSc in Psychology. The Equivalent or Lower Qualification policy prohibits me from getting a student loan. Why should people have to decide on their career aged 18! I want to work and pay taxes but I'm unable.

attributes.action: Ensure the free 15 hours of childcare covers half terms and school holidays
attributes.background:
The free 15hrs of childcare does NOT cover half terms or school holidays.

As a working parent I find it difficult to find additional childcare during this time as financially I can't afford it and unfortunately I don't work in a school and receive the same holiday times.

attributes.action: That MPs should work full time as an MP and not have outside jobs.
attributes.background: A large number of MPs appear to have numerous second jobs. My view is that being an MP should be a full time job. If they can find time to do many other jobs then they should be paid pro rata. If they have time to do other jobs then perhaps they shouldn't be an MP.
attributes.additional_details: I am also fed up of watching parliament in progress with hardly any MPs in the chamber.They are answerable to the public as they are paid out of taxes and as such are public employees. Very few employees in the public sector are allowed to have second jobs, so why should they be allowed to be able to do this.

attributes.action: To prevent MPs having anonymity if arrested.
attributes.background:
To prevent MPs having anonymity if arrested.
This was raised in the Houses of Parliament to be discussed Wednesday 10/02/2016, and may be waved through!,
They want their names concealed if I they carry out a criminal act, raised under the European Convention of Human Rights
attributes.additional_details: We vote people into government to represent us on the understanding they are honest citizens and will strive to ensure that governments are fair, and to raise on our behalf matters of public and private concern.they should enter into this office with no thought of creating anonymity being upstanding citizens.

attributes.action: Censor and ban IS 'recruiting' websites
attributes.background:
Young people are influenced by things they see online - the glories of joining and supporting IS. The government needs to work harder to censor this material, keeping our children safe from recruiting websites.
Terrorism isn't just actions, it's a movement - this starts with ideas put into minds.

attributes.action: Change the 40 year rolling exemption for classic vehicles to 30 year.
attributes.background: I feel that the standard should be revised from 40 years to 30 years. Many cars over 25 years now are classic cars and are on classic car policys which do little mileage per year. Cars over 20 years are rarely seen on the road on a daily basis so I think the above should be revised.
attributes.additional_details: My vehicle is a classic car and is 26 years old. It is on classic car insurance as there are only 30 of my vehicle on the road and is classed as a classic vehicle by my insurer so why shouldn't I get historic car status in 4 years time.

attributes.action: Eye specialist, Moorfields, should decide who is fit to drive not the DVLA.
attributes.background: An Easterman eye test is not as conclusive as the DVLA believe. Some people cannot pass one but are still considered fit to drive but the DVLA will not listen to the specialists. Organisations like Moorfields should be able to say who is fit to drive. They are the professionals.

attributes.action: Stop state funded translation services in all NHS facilities.
attributes.background: The NHS spend over £23M per year on providing translation services - that's around £63,000 per day !!  That money could and should be spent on equipment/services that benefit everyone instead of a small minority.
attributes.additional_details:
Translation services that are required should be paid for by the person requiring the services, their friends, family or privately funded migrant support groups.
Implementing this change get will not only reduce expenditure on non medical NHS funding but also provide an additional incentive for migrants to learn English and assimilate into UK society.

attributes.action: Include third sector workers on SOL to prevent them being forced out of the UK
attributes.background:
Tier 2 skilled workers must meet a £35k p/a salary threshold to remain in the UK. This makes it impossible for them to work in 3rd sector roles.
The Shortage Occupation List has been used to prevent nurses being removed from the UK. It must now be used to save charity workers, and charities.
attributes.additional_details:
Charities, voluntary organisations and social enterprises desperately need Tier 2 skilled workers, especially in IT etc, but can't match  private or civil sector salaries to entice the best workers.
It is impossible for a Tier 2 worker to switch to a Tier 5 route, which forbids a permanent job.
The Home Office must ask the Migration Advisory Committee to research the possibility of including third sector workers on the SOL.
Find out moreat stop35k.org

attributes.action: Revise self defence laws in the UK and bring back handgun ownership.
attributes.background: Enough people are dead in Europe and the time to act is upon us. GCHQ has done an amazing job at preventing terror attacks in the UK but the police cannot possibly act fast enough to save us all in case of attack by terror groups. We propose a government measure to allow civilians to keep handguns.
attributes.additional_details:
The five or six consecutive terror attacks in Europe prior to this date.

The brave US police officer who fought with the Orlando shooter to delay his spree and save hundreds.

A Switzerland style gun law attitude or Israel style will work. People in Europe are applying for gun permits in droves and can only use those guns to defend themselves at home and left defenceless in the streets.

attributes.action: Have a new runway at both Gatwick and Heathrow
attributes.background: If this Government decides on one or other it won't be long before we'll have the whole debate again. Having spare capacity at both airports will be an operational relief and set us up for the next decades.

attributes.action: All public transport buses to have seat belts.
attributes.background: I have seen many videos on social media of buses in road accidents. Passengers fly out of their seats. Young children fly out of their seats. I for one will not be taking my child on a bus until they have seat belts fitted. A bus is no different to a car. In fact it's probably worse.

attributes.action: Make Bullying illegal in the UK
attributes.background: Children are being permanently damaged but the affect of bullying it is morally wrong we as the people should be more vigilant in protecting our youth from the pain and forever damage bullying causes bullying needs to be illegal in all of its area from the simple name calling to the abuse
attributes.additional_details:
a on going debate on whether it should be illegal http://www.debate.org/opinions/should-bullying-be-illegal

http://www.teenink.com/opinion/school_college/article/331577/Should-There-Be-a-Law-Against-Bullying/

attributes.action: Ban Fixed Odds Betting Terminals
attributes.background:
Following the Gambling Act of 2005, Fixed Odds Betting Terminals are a feature in bookmakers' shops on our high streets.
Government should  give Councils powers to ban them from the high street
attributes.additional_details:
FOBTs are called the "crack cocaine" of gambling.
Users can lose hundreds of pounds in only a few minutes and can turn violent when this happens.
FOBTs destroy lives and families.
Government should act to ban them from our high streets.
